I've searched StackOverflow and now I know the reason for that:

The browser before sending a POST request with a `Content-Type` other than:

- `application/x-www-form-urlencoded`
- `multipart/form-data`
- `text/plain`

sends an `OPTIONS` request, asking whether the server can accept such a request.

You can find out more about why this happens in [this SO question](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46904400/why-do-i-get-an-options-request-after-making-a-post-request) or at MDN page about [CORS and CORS Preflight](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/CORS#Preflighted_requests).

Now you just need to properly handle this type of requests in your app.
@krzysdz you are absolutely right! I can confirm once `app.options` is introduced in my server code, the behavior is ok now. Thanks!
